I'll stream here: http://www.twitch.tv/bahamutod at around 5pm EST today, I guess. For now I need to figure out somethin cool to do so I'm not just programming the whole time.

Would you like a few aircraft for the live stream I made, for testing purposes?

I posted a list that I have made so far about 2 pages back

Also considering I have the equivalent of a 1st grade education when it comes to computers I don't believe I could simply just increase the power in config lol but I ll wait for the 1.0 update anyway

I actually just learned blender last night

I am totally lost in blender, I know my way around Photoshop though. Could you point me toward some good tutorials? I downloaded blender and managed to light my hair on fire.... Still healing.

I am totally lost in blender, I know my way around Photoshop though. Could you point me toward some good tutorials? I downloaded blender and managed to light my hair on fire.... Still healing.

Just look around YouTube for awhile I only really watched a tutorial that showed me how to make and manipulate shapes on a basic level and add background and reference images and then I kind of figured everything out for myself after that

Tips:

If you need to move an object use object mode which can be chosen from the bottom toolbar

If you need to edit an object use edit mode which can be chosen from the bottom toolbar

E is for extrude

S is for scale

R is for rotate

N brings up new options

Hold the cursor over things and a menu will give you some basic information that helps a lot.

In edit mode you can move more than one face vertex or edge at a time by using shift right click but make sure to set the target (or whatever its called its in the bottom toolbar to the left of the type of edit buttons) to individual origin.

I really don't know that much since as I said I just started last night but once you get started its actually very straightforward I've found.

If you need to edit an object use edit mode which can be chosen from the bottom toolbar

E is for extrude

Hold the cursor over things and a menu will give you some basic information that helps a lot.

In edit mode you can move more than one face vertex or edge at a time by using shift right click but make sure to set the target (or whatever its called its in the bottom toolbar to the left of the type of edit buttons) to individual origin.
